meanings.definition: To express (something) in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: She was rearticulating her thoughts to make them clearer.
meanings.sent2: The artist was rearticulating her emotions through her paintings.
meanings.sent3: He kept rearticulating the same story to entertain his friends.
meanings.sent4: The dancer was rearticulating the music with her graceful movements.
meanings.sent5: By rearticulating his argument, he convinced the audience.

meanings.definition: To adjust or rearrange (something) in order to improve or clarify it.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was rearticulating the lesson plan for better understanding.
meanings.sent2: He was rearticulating the furniture layout to create more space.
meanings.sent3: The chef was rearticulating the recipe to enhance the flavors.
meanings.sent4: She was rearticulating her schedule to fit in more activities.
meanings.sent5: By rearticulating the instructions, he made the task easier.
